TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit PackageManager extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Class for retrieving various kinds of information related to the application packages that are currently installed on the device.

remarks.para:
Class for retrieving various kinds of information related to the application packages that are currently installed on the device.
You can find this class through .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddPackageToPreferred(string packageName) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool AddPermission(class Android.Content.PM.PermissionInfo info) cil managed

Docs.param: Description of the permission to be added.
Docs.summary: Add a new dynamic permission to the system.

remarks.para: Add a new dynamic permission to the system. For this to work, your package must have defined a permission tree through the tag in its manifest. A package can only add permissions to trees that were defined by either its own package or another with the same user id; a permission is in a tree if it matches the name of the permission tree + ".": for example, "com.foo.bar" is a member of the permission tree "com.foo".

It is good to make your permission tree name descriptive, because you are taking possession of that entire set of permission names. Thus, it must be under a domain you control, with a suffix that will not match any normal permissions that may be declared in any applications that are part of that domain.

New permissions must be added before any .apks are installed that use those permissions. Permissions you add through this method are remembered across reboots of the device. If the given permission already exists, the info you supply here will be used to update it.

Docs.exception: if you are not allowed to add the given permission name.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool AddPermissionAsync(class Android.Content.PM.PermissionInfo info) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.
Docs.summary: Like but asynchronously persists the package manager state after returning from the call, allowing it to return quicker and batch a series of adds at the expense of no guarantee the added permission will be retained if the device is rebooted before it is written.

remarks.para: Like but asynchronously persists the package manager state after returning from the call, allowing it to return quicker and batch a series of adds at the expense of no guarantee the added permission will be retained if the device is rebooted before it is written.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Android.Content.PM.SignatureResult CheckSignatures (int uid1, int uid2);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Content.PM.SignatureResult CheckSignatures(int32 uid1, int32 uid2) cil managed

Docs.param: First UID whose signature will be compared.
Second UID whose signature will be compared.
Docs.summary: Compare the signatures of two packages to determine if the same signature appears in both of them.

remarks.para: Like , but takes UIDs of the two packages to be checked. This can be useful, for example, when doing the check in an IPC, where the UID is the only identity available. It is functionally identical to determining the package associated with the UIDs and checking their signatures.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Android.Content.PM.SignatureResult CheckSignatures (string pkg1, string pkg2);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Content.PM.SignatureResult CheckSignatures(string pkg1, string pkg2) cil managed

Docs.param: First package name whose signature will be compared.
Second package name whose signature will be compared.
Docs.summary: Compare the signatures of two packages to determine if the same signature appears in both of them.

remarks.para: Compare the signatures of two packages to determine if the same signature appears in both of them. If they do contain the same signature, then they are allowed special privileges when working with each other: they can share the same user-id, run instrumentation against each other, etc.

Docs.param: The name of the package whose preferred activity mappings are to be removed.
Docs.summary: Remove all preferred activity mappings, previously added with , from the system whose activities are implemented in the given package name.

remarks.para: Remove all preferred activity mappings, previously added with , from the system whose activities are implemented in the given package name. An application can only clear its own package(s).

Docs.summary: Flag parameter for to indicate that you don't want to kill the app containing the component.

remarks.para: Flag parameter for to indicate that you don't want to kill the app containing the component. Be careful when you set this since changing component states can make the containing application's behavior unpredictable.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void ExtendVerificationTimeout (int id, Android.Content.PM.PackageInstallVerification verificationCodeAtTimeout, long millisecondsToDelay);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ExtendVerificationTimeout(int32 id, valuetype Android.Content.PM.PackageInstallVerification verificationCodeAtTimeout, int64 millisecondsToDelay) cil managed

Docs.param: pending package identifier as passed via the Intent extra.
either or . If verificationCodeAtTimeout is neither or , then verificationCodeAtTimeout will default to .
the amount of time requested for the timeout. Must be positive and less than . If millisecondsToDelay is out of bounds, millisecondsToDelay will be set to the closest in bounds value; namely, 0 or .
Docs.summary: Allows a package listening to the to extend the default timeout for a response and declare what action to perform after the timeout occurs.

remarks.para:
Allows a package listening to the to extend the default timeout for a response and declare what action to perform after the timeout occurs. The response must include the verificationCodeAtTimeout which is one of or .
This method may only be called once per package id. Additional calls will have no effect.

Docs.exception: if the caller does not have the PACKAGE_VERIFICATION_AGENT permission.

Docs.summary: Extra field name for the ID of a package pending verification.

remarks.para: Extra field name for the ID of a package pending verification. Passed to a package verifier and is used to call back to

Docs.summary: Extra field name for the result of a verification, either , or .

remarks.para: Extra field name for the result of a verification, either , or . Passed to package verifiers after a package is verified.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports app widgets.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports app widgets.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device's audio pipeline is low-latency, more suitable for audio applications sensitive to delays or lag in sound input or output.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device's audio pipeline is low-latency, more suitable for audio applications sensitive to delays or lag in sound input or output.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device includes at least one form of audio output, such as speakers, audio jack or streaming over bluetooth

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device includes at least one form of audio output, such as speakers, audio jack or streaming over bluetooth

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device can perform backup and restore operations on installed applications.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device can perform backup and restore operations on installed applications.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The Connection Service API is enabled on the device.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The Connection Service API is enabled on the device.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device is capable of communicating with consumer IR devices.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device is capable of communicating with consumer IR devices.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports device policy enforcement via device admins.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports device policy enforcement via device admins.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device does not have a touch screen, but does support touch emulation for basic events.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device does not have a touch screen, but does support touch emulation for basic events. For instance, the device might use a mouse or remote control to drive a cursor, and emulate basic touch pointer events like down, up, drag, etc. All devices that support android.hardware.touchscreen or a sub-feature are presumed to also support faketouch.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device does not have a touch screen, but does support touch emulation for basic events that supports distinct tracking of two or more fingers.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device does not have a touch screen, but does support touch emulation for basic events that supports distinct tracking of two or more fingers. This is an extension of for input devices with this capability. Note that unlike a distinct multitouch screen as defined by , these kinds of input devices will not actually provide full two-finger gestures since the input is being transformed to cursor movement on the screen. That is, single finger gestures will move a cursor; two-finger swipes will result in single-finger touch events; other two-finger gestures will result in the corresponding two-finger touch event.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device does not have a touch screen, but does support touch emulation for basic events that supports tracking a hand of fingers (5 or more fingers) fully independently.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device does not have a touch screen, but does support touch emulation for basic events that supports tracking a hand of fingers (5 or more fingers) fully independently. This is an extension of for input devices with this capability. Note that unlike a multitouch screen as defined by , not all two finger gestures can be detected due to the limitations described for .

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device has all of the inputs necessary to be considered a compatible game controller, or includes a compatible game controller in the box.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device has all of the inputs necessary to be considered a compatible game controller, or includes a compatible game controller in the box.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports a home screen that is replaceable by third party applications.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports a home screen that is replaceable by third party applications.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports adding new input methods implemented with the API.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports adding new input methods implemented with the API.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports leanback UI.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports leanback UI. This is typically used in a living room television experience, but is a software feature unlike . Devices running with this feature will use resources associated with the "television" UI mode.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports live TV and can display contents from TV inputs implemented with the API.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports live TV and can display contents from TV inputs implemented with the API.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports live wallpapers.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports live wallpapers.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports one or more methods of reporting current location.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports one or more methods of reporting current location.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device has a Global Positioning System receiver and can report precise location.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device has a Global Positioning System receiver and can report precise location.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device can report location with coarse accuracy using a network-based geolocation system.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device can report location with coarse accuracy using a network-based geolocation system.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports creating secondary users and managed profiles via .

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports creating secondary users and managed profiles via .

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device can record audio via a microphone.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device can record audio via a microphone.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device can communicate using Near-Field Communications (NFC).

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device can communicate using Near-Field Communications (NFC).

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports host- based NFC card emulation.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports host- based NFC card emulation.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports the OpenGL ES .

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports the OpenGL ES .

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports printing.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports printing.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports landscape orientation screens.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports landscape orientation screens. For backwards compatibility, you can assume that if neither this nor is set then the device supports both portrait and landscape.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports portrait orientation screens.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports portrait orientation screens. For backwards compatibility, you can assume that if neither this nor is set then the device supports both portrait and landscape.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports secure removal of users.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports secure removal of users. When a user is deleted the data associated with that user is securely deleted and no longer available.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device includes an accelerometer.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device includes an accelerometer.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device includes an ambient temperature sensor.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device includes an ambient temperature sensor.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device includes a barometer (air pressure sensor.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device includes a barometer (air pressure sensor.)

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device includes a magnetometer (compass).

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device includes a magnetometer (compass).

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device includes a gyroscope.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device includes a gyroscope.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device includes a heart rate monitor.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device includes a heart rate monitor.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The heart rate sensor on this device is an Electrocargiogram.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The heart rate sensor on this device is an Electrocargiogram.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device includes a light sensor.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device includes a light sensor.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device includes a proximity sensor.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device includes a proximity sensor.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device includes a relative humidity sensor.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device includes a relative humidity sensor.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device includes a hardware step counter.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device includes a hardware step counter.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device includes a hardware step detector.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device includes a hardware step detector.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The SIP API is enabled on the device.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The SIP API is enabled on the device.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports SIP-based VOIP.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports SIP-based VOIP.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device has a telephony radio with data communication support.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device has a telephony radio with data communication support.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device has a CDMA telephony stack.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device has a CDMA telephony stack.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device has a GSM telephony stack.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device has a GSM telephony stack.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : This is a device dedicated to showing UI on a television.

remarks.para: Feature for and : This is a device dedicated to showing UI on a television. Television here is defined to be a typical living room television experience: displayed on a big screen, where the user is sitting far away from it, and the dominant form of input will be something like a DPAD, not through touch or mouse.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device's display has a touch screen.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device's display has a touch screen.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device's touch screen supports multitouch sufficient for basic two-finger gesture detection.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device's touch screen supports multitouch sufficient for basic two-finger gesture detection.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device's touch screen is capable of tracking two or more fingers fully independently.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device's touch screen is capable of tracking two or more fingers fully independently.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device's touch screen is capable of tracking a full hand of fingers fully independently -- that is, 5 or more simultaneous independent pointers.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device's touch screen is capable of tracking a full hand of fingers fully independently -- that is, 5 or more simultaneous independent pointers.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports connecting to USB accessories.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports connecting to USB accessories.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports connecting to USB devices as the USB host.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports connecting to USB devices as the USB host.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports verified boot.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports verified boot.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : This is a device dedicated to showing UI on a watch.

remarks.para: Feature for and : This is a device dedicated to showing UI on a watch. A watch here is defined to be a device worn on the body, perhaps on the wrist. The user is very close when interacting with the device.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device has a full implementation of the android.webkit.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device has a full implementation of the android.webkit.* APIs. Devices lacking this feature will not have a functioning WebView implementation.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports WiFi (802.11) networking.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports WiFi (802.11) networking.

Docs.summary: Feature for and : The device supports Wi-Fi Direct networking.

remarks.para: Feature for and : The device supports Wi-Fi Direct networking.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable GetActivityBanner(class Android.Content.ComponentName activityName) cil managed

Docs.param: Name of the activity whose banner is to be retrieved.
Docs.summary: Retrieve the banner associated with an Intent.

remarks.para: Retrieve the banner associated with an activity. Given the full name of an activity, retrieves the information about it and calls to return its banner. If the activity cannot be found, NameNotFoundException is thrown.

Docs.exception: Thrown if the resources for the given activity could not be loaded.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable GetActivityBanner(class Android.Content.Intent intent) cil managed

Docs.param: The intent for which you would like to retrieve a banner.
Docs.summary: Retrieve the banner associated with an Intent.

remarks.para: Retrieve the banner associated with an Intent. If intent.getClassName() is set, this simply returns the result of getActivityBanner(intent.getClassName()). Otherwise it resolves the intent's component and returns the banner associated with the resolved component. If intent.getClassName() cannot be found or the Intent cannot be resolved to a component, NameNotFoundException is thrown.

Docs.exception: Thrown if the resources for application matching the given intent could not be loaded.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Content.Intent GetLaunchIntentForPackage(string packageName) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the package to inspect.
Docs.summary: Returns a "good" intent to launch a front-door activity in a package.

remarks.para: Returns a "good" intent to launch a front-door activity in a package. This is used, for example, to implement an "open" button when browsing through packages. The current implementation looks first for a main activity in the category , and next for a main activity in the category . Returns null if neither are found.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Content.Intent GetLeanbackLaunchIntentForPackage(string packageName) cil managed

remarks.para: Return a "good" intent to launch a front-door Leanback activity in a package, for use for example to implement an "open" button when browsing through packages. The current implementation will look for a main activity in the category , or return null if no main leanback activities are found.
Throws if a package with the given name cannot be found on the system.

Docs.param: The user id for which you would like to retrieve a name.
Docs.summary: Retrieve the official name associated with a user id.

remarks.para: Retrieve the official name associated with a user id. This name is guaranteed to never change, though it is possibly for the underlying user id to be changed. That is, if you are storing information about user ids in persistent storage, you should use the string returned by this function instead of the raw user-id.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable GetUserBadgedDrawableForDensity (Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable drawable, Android.OS.UserHandle user, Android.Graphics.Rect badgeLocation, int badgeDensity);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable GetUserBadgedDrawableForDensity(class Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable drawable, class Android.OS.UserHandle user, class Android.Graphics.Rect badgeLocation, int32 badgeDensity) cil managed

Docs.param: The drawable to badge.
The target user.
Where in the bounds of the badged drawable to place the badge. If not provided, the badge is applied on top of the entire drawable being badged.
The optional desired density for the badge as per . If not provided, the density of the display is used.
Docs.summary: If the target user is a managed profile of the calling user or the caller is itself a managed profile, then this returns a badged copy of the given drawable allowing the user to distinguish it from the original drawable.

remarks.para: If the target user is a managed profile of the calling user or the caller is itself a managed profile, then this returns a badged copy of the given drawable allowing the user to distinguish it from the original drawable. The caller can specify the location in the bounds of the drawable to be badged where the badge should be applied as well as the density of the badge to be used.
If the original drawable is a BitmapDrawable and the backing bitmap is mutable as per , the bading is performed in place and the original drawable is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable GetUserBadgedIcon (Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable icon, Android.OS.UserHandle user);

The target user.
Docs.summary: If the target user is a managed profile of the calling user or the caller is itself a managed profile, then this returns a badged copy of the given icon to be able to distinguish it from the original icon.

remarks.para: If the target user is a managed profile of the calling user or the caller is itself a managed profile, then this returns a badged copy of the given icon to be able to distinguish it from the original icon. For badging an arbitrary drawable use .
If the original drawable is a BitmapDrawable and the backing bitmap is mutable as per , the badging is performed in place and the original drawable is returned.

remarks.para: Removes a permission that was previously added with . The same ownership rules apply -- you are only allowed to remove permissions that you are allowed to add.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Android.Content.PM.ResolveInfo ResolveActivity (Android.Content.Intent intent, Android.Content.PM.PackageInfoFlags flags);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Content.PM.ResolveInfo ResolveActivity(class Android.Content.Intent intent, valuetype Android.Content.PM.PackageInfoFlags flags) cil managed

Docs.param: An intent containing all of the desired specification (action, data, type, category, and/or component).
Additional option flags. The most important is , to limit the resolution to only those activities that support the .
Docs.summary: Determine the best action to perform for a given Intent.

remarks.para: Determine the best action to perform for a given Intent. This is how finds an activity if a class has not been explicitly specified.

Note: if using an implicit Intent (without an explicit ComponentName specified), be sure to consider whether to set the only flag. You need to do so to resolve the activity in the same way that and do.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void SetApplicationEnabledSetting (string packageName, Android.Content.PM.ComponentEnabledState newState, Android.Content.PM.ComponentEnableOption flags);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetApplicationEnabledSetting(string packageName, valuetype Android.Content.PM.ComponentEnabledState newState, valuetype Android.Content.PM.ComponentEnableOption flags) cil managed

Docs.param: The package name of the application to enable

The new enabled state for the component. The legal values for this state are: ,
and
The last one removes the setting, thereby restoring the applications's state to whatever was set in its manifest (or enabled, by default).
Optional behavior flags: or 0.
Docs.summary: Set the enabled setting for an application This setting will override any enabled state which may have been set by the application in its manifest.

remarks.para: Set the enabled setting for an application This setting will override any enabled state which may have been set by the application in its manifest. It also overrides the enabled state set in the manifest for any of the application's components. It does not override any enabled state set by for any of the application's components.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void SetComponentEnabledSetting (Android.Content.ComponentName componentName, Android.Content.PM.ComponentEnabledState newState, Android.Content.PM.ComponentEnableOption flags);

Docs.param: The component to enable

The new enabled state for the component. The legal values for this state are: ,
and
The last one removes the setting, thereby restoring the component's state to whatever was set in it's manifest (or enabled, by default).
Optional behavior flags: or 0.
Docs.summary: Set the enabled setting for a package component (activity, receiver, service, provider).

remarks.para: Set the enabled setting for a package component (activity, receiver, service, provider). This setting will override any enabled state which may have been set by the component in its manifest.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void SetInstallerPackageName (string targetPackage, string installerPackageName);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetInstallerPackageName(string targetPackage, string installerPackageName) cil managed

Docs.param: The installed package whose installer will be changed.
The package name of the new installer. May be null to clear the association.
Docs.summary: Change the installer associated with a given package.

remarks.para:
Change the installer associated with a given package. There are limitations on how the installer package can be changed; in particular:
A SecurityException will be thrown if installerPackageName is not signed with the same certificate as the calling application.
A SecurityException will be thrown if targetPackage already has an installer package, and that installer package is not signed with the same certificate as the calling application.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
